title: Collaborative Learning Design for Non-IT Subjects in IT Students: Application to Language Domains

context.prior_knowledge: Basic IT literacy and field experience in educational settings
context.additional_context: The goal is for pre-service teachers to acquire methodologies for effectively teaching non-IT subjects (e.g., language) in IT environments. Practical insights are strengthened through ELIS system utilization and collaborative learning in smartphone-centric, resource-limited settings.

learning_goals: Learners can use the ELIS system to plan and execute self-directed learning strategies for non-IT language subjects.
Learners can derive practical insights into real-world language education scenarios through online collaborative learning.
Learners can demonstrate the ability to integrate IT tools with non-IT content via project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
